DOC.brief_summary: Evaluate the effectiveness of the use of a 24% sucrose solution for pain management of preterm infants during endotracheal suctioning.
DOC.brief_title: Pain Relief of Newborn Preterm Infants During Endotracheal Suctioning
DOC.detailed_description: Many infants admitted to neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) undergo repeated invasive procedures. Recent studies have shown that the oral sucrose administration to neonates is safe and effective for pain relief during heel stick and venipuncture.Most data suggest the investigation of the effect of sucrose in other painful procedures such as in ventilated newborns.
